description: Keith Haring's "Barking Dog Blue" (1994) in a silver metal frame. The painting shows the outline of a stylized, blocky white dog with a thick black outline and four black lines to the left of its mouth to indicate that it's barking. At the bottom of the painting in a bold font are the words Keith Haring.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.

user.name: VertexArchive
user.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.

content: Today's Vertex is not based on one specific work by Keith Haring - barking dogs were a common symbol in his work. Here are two pieces he did which combine to a sort of composite of today's puzzle.
